etymology.description: ideogram: two parallel strokes; duplication of 一.
etymology.interpretation: Two horizontal lines directly depict the quantity ‘two’ as simple tally marks. It parallels 一 and 三 as incremental strokes, with historical 亖 for four, emphasizing straightforward counting by repetition.

examples.chinese: 今天是二月二日(今天是二月二日)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān shì èr yuè èr rì.

examples.chinese: 我住在二楼(我住在二樓)。
examples.english: I live on the second floor.

examples.chinese: 二加二等于四(二加二等於四)。
